title: What is the importance of distinguishing between different phenomena in mesmerism and hypnotism?
first_phrase: In this text, the author talks about the dangers that can arise during an experiment of hypnosis. If the experimenter fails to bring the subject back to consciousness quickly enough, it can be fatal. The author, who has conducted numerous experiments on thousands of subjects, plans to publish a detailed description of the varied phenomena that can be provoked. The last 200 tokens discuss the difference between the experiments of muteness, aphasia, and the deprivation of speech, and the importance of distinguishing between different hypnotic phenomena. The text names several medical professionals and researchers who were present at a session where the author demonstrated his experiments.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the discovery of experimental fascination by Donato in 1875, as a new branch of animal magnetism, has produced significant results. His method involves subjecting a person to sudden willpower by staring deeply into their eyes, which can induce a state of subjugation. This phenomena has been studied alongside other related practices, such as somnambulism, catalepsy, and hypnotism. Though the theories behind these practices differ, the influence of the operator is undeniable. Donato's ability to easily magnify subjects and achieve significant results speaks to the effectiveness of his technique.
